properties.headline: Wind Chill Advisory issued January 8 at 4:55AM AKST until January 10 at 12:00PM AKST by NWS Fairbanks, AK
properties.description:
* WHAT...Very cold wind chills expected. The cold wind chills will
cause frostbite in as little as 10 minutes to exposed skin.
Expect wind chills to 55 below zero.

* WHERE...Baldwin Peninsula and Selawik Valley.

* WHEN...6 PM this evening to noon Friday.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...East winds will develop tonight and
continue into Friday. This will cause very cold winds chills and
drifting snow.
properties.instruction:
A Wind Chill Advisory means that cold air and sustained wind
speeds of 15 mph or more will create low wind chills. Frost bite
and hypothermia can occur if precautions are not taken.

NWSheadline: WIND CHILL ADVISORY IN EFFECT FROM 6 PM THIS EVENING TO NOON AKST FRIDAY
